English: Ohhh? Is that Yuuko I spy over there?
Chinese:
哎呀～？
在那裡的人，該不會是小悠子吧～？
Korean:
어머~?
혹시 거기에 있는건 유코가 아니니~?
German: Oha? Sehe ich da drüben Yuuko?

English:
That's Kamishiro's executive officer, Rie Kishibe.
But calm down, you'll be fine in that form.
Just fake it 'til you make it!
Chinese:
……那個人是神代的幹部「岸部里繪」喔。
但是冷靜一點，用現在這副模樣一定很安全！
要好好地蒙混過去喔！
Korean:
……그 사람이 카미시로의 간부「키시베 리에」야.
그래도 진정해. 그 모습이라면 괜찮아! 잘 속여넘겨봐
German:
Das ist die Geschäftsführerin von Kamishiro,
Rie Kishibe. Aber nur ruhig, in dieser Gestalt
ist ja alles okay. Spiel einfach mit!

English:
What in the world are you doing allll the way out
here, Yuuko? It's still a while before we're
supposed to meet...
Chinese:
小悠子～在這種地方做些什麼啊～？
離和我約好見面的時間還很久耶～……
Korean:
유코~ 이런 곳에서 뭐얼~하고 있는 걸까~
나와의 약속 시간은 아직 멀었는데~……
German:
Was machst du denn so weit hier draußen, Yuuko?
Wir treffen uns doch erst später ...

English:
Could it be? Have you got a D-A-T-E?
...Hee hee, couldn't be!
Chinese:
該不會～♪
是要和別人約．會☆
……應該不會吧～？
Korean:
혹시~♪
누군가랑 데 이 트♥ ……일 리가 없겠지~?
German:
Kann es sein? Hast du etwa eine Verabredung?
Hihi ... Nein, kann nicht sein.

English:
...I'm lost.
...I have a date.
I just got here a bit early.
Chinese:
……我迷路了。
……是約會沒錯。
我太早到了呢☆
Korean:
……미아입니다
……데이트입니다
빨리 와버렸어요♥
German:
... Ich habe mich verlaufen.
... Ich habe eine Verabredung.
Ich bin einfach ein bisschen früher da.

English:
My, you got lost in here? But I wonder, what
brought you here in the first place?
Chinese:
哎呀～在這種地方迷路？
嗯～究竟是為了什麼事迷路呢～？
Korean:
어머~ 이런 곳에서 미아~?
응~ 무슨 소리를 하는 걸까~?
German:
Ach, du hast dich hier verlaufen? Aber was hast
du denn überhaupt hier gesucht?

English:
It's no big deal, you say? Aww, but Yuuko! You're
always doing things on your own!
Chinese:
不是什麼重要的事，叫我不用在意？
真是的，小悠子不管做什麼，都是自己來呢♪
Korean:
별 일 아니니까 신경쓰지 말라고?
유코도 차암 뭐든 혼자서 해버린다니까♪
German:
Nicht weiter wichtig, sagst du? Aber Yuuko.
Machst immer dein eigenes Ding.

English:
Myyy myyy!
Yuuko's finally growing up!
Chinese:
哎呀～～～～☆
小悠子終於也要登上大人的階梯了啊～♪
Korean:
어머나~~~~♥
드디어 유코도 어른의 계단을 올라버렸네~♪
German:
Oha, oha!
Yuuko wird endlich erwachsen!

English:
C'mon, who's the lucky guy? Is he tall? Rich? Ooo,
is he haaandsome?
Chinese:
所以呢～妳的男朋友是個怎麼樣的人呢？
長得高嗎？　是有錢人？　還是說，是個帥哥呢～？
Korean:
근데에~ 상대 남자는 어떤 아이일까?
키는 크니? 돈은 많니? 역시 꽃미남일까~?
German:
Na, wer ist denn der Glückspilz? Ist er groß?
Reich? Sieht er gut aus?

English:
Eeee, you're so CUTE, Yuuko! You just couldn't
wait to see me, I suppose.
Chinese:
真～是～的，小悠子真．是．太．可．愛了☆
就這～麼等不及要跟我見面嗎～♪
Korean:
어~~머, 유코도 참 귀 여 워 라♥
나랑 만나는 걸 그~~렇게나 기대한 거구나~♪
German:
Ach, was bist du süß, Yuuko. Konntest es gar
nicht erwarten, mich zu sehen.

English:
...Hmmm? There's something a bit fishy about you.
Are you reaaally Yuuko?
Chinese:
……嗯嗯～？　但是，總覺得哪～裡怪怪的呢～
妳真的是小悠子嗎～？
Korean:
……응응~? 그치만 무~언가 수상한걸~
너 정말 유코인거지~?
German:
... Hmmm? Irgendwas stimmt nicht.
Bist du wirklich Yuuko?

English:
...Yes.
...Don't be silly.
It's me, Yuuko Kamishiro!
Chinese:
……是我沒錯
……我不是
我是神代悠子☆
Korean:
……그렇습니다
……아닙니다
카미시로 유코예요♥
German:
... Ja.
... Na, wer denn sonst.
Ich bin’s, Yuuko Kamishiro!

English: Really?
German: Wirklich?

English: Like, reaaaally?
Chinese: 嗯嗯嗯嗯嗯～～？
Korean: 응응응응응~~?
German: Also so ganz wirklich?

English:
Yes, of course. I mean...it's not like you're
somebody else using Yuuko's avatar, right?
Chinese:
果然是這樣～？　外表是小悠子的化身，
裡面其實是其他人這～樣……
該不會是這樣子吧～？
Korean:
그렇지~? 겉은 유코의 아바타지만 속은
다른 사람~이라던가…… 설마 그럴 리는 없겠지~?
German:
Ja, natürlich. Du wirst ja kaum wer anders sein,
der sich des Avatars bedient, wie?

English:
Juuust kidding! Hee hee hee! I just thought it'd
be funny if it was true. Just imagining, what if,
right?!
Chinese:
開～玩～笑的啦☆　呵呵～～♪
覺得如果是那樣子會很有趣嘛，是里繪的妄想喔♪
Korean:
랄~까나♥ 훗후후~훙♪
그러면 재미있겠다~ 라는 리에의 망상♪
German:
War nur Scherz! Hihihi! Dachte mir nur, das wäre
lustig, wenn es stimmt. Nur so eine Idee,
nicht wahr?

English: Uh, Yuuko...?
Chinese: 小、悠子……？
Korean: 유, 유코……?
German: Äh, Yuuko ...?

English: Could it be, you...
Chinese: 妳，該不會……
Korean: 너 설마……
German: Kann es sein, dass du ...

English:
...are you that tired?! Aw, you poor thing! You
gotta remember to rest every once in a while.
Chinese:
是累了吧～！　好可憐喔～！
這可不行，要好～好地休息才可以喔。
Korean:
너무 피곤한 거구나~! 불쌍해라~!
그러면 안 되지, 제~대로 쉬어줘야지
German:
Dass du so müde bist?! Ach, du Arme! Du musst
dich auch ab und zu mal ausruhen.

English:
In that case, let's cancel our plans for today.
See you later! Make sure to get some rest, okay?
Chinese:
這樣的話，今天的約會就先取消吧♪
再．見．囉～☆　要好好休息才行喔～？
Korean:
그렇다면 오늘 약속은 취소하자♪
가 끔 은♥ 충분히 쉬어줘~
German:
Lass uns in diesem Fall doch heute absagen.
Bis dann! Ruh dich auch gut aus, ja?

English: *whew* My heart was racing!
Chinese: 呼～在旁邊看得我都為你捏了把冷汗。
Korean: 후우~ 보기만 해도 조마조마해
German: *Puh* Ich hatte richtig Herzklopfen!

English:
Looks like you pulled it off... Still, that person
is kinda scary.
Chinese:
好不容易蒙混過去了呢……
我覺得那個人有點恐怖。
Korean:
어떻게든 속여넘겼지만……
나 저 사람 왠지 무서워
German:
Du hast es wohl geschafft ... Aber die ist ganz
schön furchterregend.

English:
There's definitely something off about her.
And yet she's...so attractive...
Chinese:
確實有點恐怖……
恐怖…………但是很性感。
Korean:
확실히 어딘가 섬뜩해……
하지만…………섹시해
German:
Irgendwas ist an der eindeutig faul.
Und doch ist sie so ... hübsch ...

English: Yes indeed... Let's move on before she comes back.
Chinese:
對呀……
趁那個人還沒回來以前，趕快往前進吧。
Korean:
그렇지……
저 사람이 돌아오기 전에 빨리 진행하자
German:
Ja, ja. Gehen wir weiter, bevor sie noch
wiederkommt.

English:
Wahhh, I'm getting some crazy emotion data from
Erika's memory server.
Chinese:
嗚哇…艾莉卡的記憶伺服器
傳了好多情感資料過來喔。
Korean:
우와…에리카의 기억 서버에서 엄청난 감정 데이터가
전해지고 있어
German:
Ufff, ich kriege ein paar irre Emotionsdaten von
Erikas Erinnerungsserver.

English: Is this..."contempt"?
Chinese: 這是……“唾棄＂？
Korean: 이게……"경멸"?
German: Ist das ... „Verachtung“?
